newsitem.title: SPAIN: St Louis buys 3.1 pct of Ebro - paper.
newsitem.headline: St Louis buys 3.1 pct of Ebro - paper.

text.p: France's Saint Louis unit Generale Sucriere has bought a further 3.1 percent stake in Spanish sugar group Ebro Agricolas, Spanish daily Negocios reported on Saturday.
The newspaper said Generale Sucriere had bought 1.5 million shares in Ebro at a price of 2,710 pesetas per share last week through Ibersecurities.
The purchase raises Generale Sucriere's stake in Ebro to 18.43 percent, the paper said. Generale Sucriere bought a 15 percent stake in Ebro in January from Banco Santander.
Generale Sucriere said in December it intended to maintain or perhaps increase its 20.7 percent stake in Spanish sugar group Azucarera after it merged with Ebro.
The upcoming merger, which will create the fifth largest sugar group in the European Union, was approved in December.
Ebro shares closed unchanged on Friday at 2,740 pesetas while Azucarera closed 50 pesetas down at 7,100 pesetas.
